name: A. Road To Zero
statement:
You are given two integers x and y. You can perform two types of
operations: Pay a dollars and increase or decrease any of these integers
by 1. For example, if x = 0 and y = 7 there are four possible outcomes
after this operation: x = 0, y = 6; x = 0, y = 8; x = -1, y = 7; x = 1,
y = 7. Pay b dollars and increase or decrease both integers by 1. For
example, if x = 0 and y = 7 there are two possible outcomes after this
operation: x = -1, y = 6; x = 1, y = 8. Your goal is to make both given
integers equal zero simultaneously, i.e. x = y = 0. There are no other
requirements. In particular, it is possible to move from x=1, y=0 to
x=y=0.Calculate the minimum amount of dollars you have to spend on it.
